posts.name: Ran
posts.cooked: Mdd the option to mention everyone in a group with @everyone (like in discord)

link_counts.title: How can Signal be better for communities and organisers?

posts.cooked:
Already mentioned in this post

@mention tagging in groups Feature Requests
I‚Äôm sure they are actively working on the mentioning feature. Gonna be a big deal once it comes out. I also think there should be an ‚Äò@all‚Äô or ‚Äò@everyone‚Äô tag for announcements like - ‚ÄúHey guys remember the movie starts at 10pm!‚Äù.

Not sure an additional feature request thread is needed. Please continue discussion there.

Sometimes I wish I could send a notification to all the contacts in a group to announce something or quickly get their attention. You could always tag everyone, but having a @here or @channel or @all would be very nice!

posts.name: Brochard
posts.cooked:
I love your proposition, @here is a nice way to have most Online status functionalities without its criticisms since we can contact connected people without knowing if they‚Äôre connected.
There is also Show status to specific channels solution that would help in other cases, but I would absolutely love this feature.

link_counts.title: Ability to share your online status only with certain people in a certain moment

posts.cooked: I think the idea here was more to tag everyone rather than notifying only the people online ‚Äî which make sense for an application like Slack (often always on), less for something like Signal (reply and leave). I support the criticism towards online statuses.

posts.name: Brochard
posts.cooked: I just have a pc user perspective coming from discord, I‚Äôm just saying @here would be great to fill in most Online Status advantages.

posts.name: Dan H
posts.cooked: I work with Search and Rescue, and we have been trying to finda an app, that allows us to mute general notifications to group and when there is a call-out we can @ notify the entire group with single @ notify, like @everyone which overrides the group notification, waking people up in the night, etc. Then as each person responds to the group notification, its not disruptive. we tend to put a really annoying notification on the group chat, but I do not want all persons responses, going off when trying to responding to callout, and then when we get to the deployment area, we can review who is coming and their ETA. Ideally there might be two customize separate notifications sounds for @everyone vs other notifications. The @ for direct message override is not sufficient, try waking up at 2am and @ direct message 25 to 50 people in group, its not really doable. To me in a group, there is a reason to disable notification in a team setting, unless there is an ‚Äúurgent‚Äù like @everyone message.

posts.name: Suraj Chakravarthi
posts.cooked:
This feature is super useful. Using @everyone or @here would really speed up notifying everyone especially in a large group.

This is also becoming increasingly popular due to signal and discord. So, there‚Äôs not a lot of reeducation that‚Äôs needed.
One problem that I see is what the mention would be called if the used locale of the app is not English. But I suppose it could just be added to the list of options when you type an @.

In MS Teams this is done with @ < channel name>
This channel name might be longer, but will always be recognized by the users and in correct language choosen by them.
@all / @everyone would be way easier than manually tagging everyone. Also add a separate notification toggle to block @all, @mention, both @all and @mention or none.

I would like to have a @all or @here mention for groups so I can address all members of a group.
Example: ‚Äú@all I celebrate my birthday on 12th of December. Please react with a thumbs up, if you want to come.‚Äù

Also an option to create custom mentions, to which members can subscribe to, could also be useful.
Example: ‚Äú@gamers. There is cyberpunk on sale on steam.‚Äù And people can adjust, if the want to subscribe to this mention.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Wouldn‚Äôt that literally just be a normal message?
No, @mentions notify you, and I believe it overrides the mute. So it would let someone ignore a chat unless they‚Äôre specifically mentioned or if someone intentionally mentions everyone.

posts.name: Orange Elephant
posts.cooked: Also mentions have the additional notice on the chat list on android, and a button to scroll direct to them which could be handy for not missing an important message.

posts.name: Max
posts.cooked:
I would also really welcome this feature.
Let admins toggle if only them or everyone can use the group wide mention and maybe add an option to the notification for ‚Äúonly personal mentions‚Äù besides just ‚Äúmentions‚Äù.

That would eliminate the risk of spam and it would be such a good feature.

I have a group chat of people that want to chat and people who only want to give and receive announcements. I am contemplating just opening two groups, but that will get super confusing and I don‚Äôt trust peopls discipline to bring all discussion into the discussion group.

For the localization issue I really support the idea of mentioning the groups name.
